Documentation

Filtration.__compute_phi — Method
__compute_phi(
    t::Real,
    extremal::Extremal,
    model::Model;
    p
) -> Real

Compute the value of the function $t \mapsto \phi(x(t), p(t))$ on a given time $t$ of an Extremal computed on a Model.

Arguments

  • t : a real time $t$
  • extremal : the Extremal
  • model : the Model

Keyword arguments (optional)

  • p : a vector of parameter for the model (default is the parametes of the model).

Return

  • phi : the value of $\phi(t)$.

Returns

Filtration.get_arrow_time — Method
get_arrow_time(
    value::Vector{<:Real},
    sol::SciMLBase.ODESolution,
    axis::Symbol
) -> Vector{<:Real}

Compute the time $t$ for which sol(t) ∈ y_value

Arguments

  • y_value : vector of y-axis value
  • sol : state trajectory as an ODESolution

Return

  • times : Vector of times
Filtration.real_solve_control — Method
real_solve_control(
    model::Model,
    init_x₂::Real,
    end_x₂::Real,
    init_x₁::Real,
    N::Int64
) -> Solution

Transform a control extracted from a solution of a Model into a real control, composed only by -1 and 1 values. The singular arc is subdivided into N intervals, and the time passed with u =+1 is proportional to the singular control.

Arguments

  • model : a Model
  • control : a Control extracted from a solution of a Model
  • N : the number of subdivision of the singular arc

Return

  • new_control : a Control composed only by -1 and 1 values
Filtration.real_solve_singular — Method
real_solve_singular(
    model::Model,
    init_x₂::Real,
    end_x₂::Real,
    init_x₁::Real,
    N::Int64;
    verbose
) -> Solution

Transform a control extracted from a solution of a Model into a real control, composed only by -1 and 1 values. The singular arc is subdivided into N intervals. On each subintervals, we ensure that the constol minimize the cost and saatisfy that the begining and the end of the state $x\_1$each subintervals corresponds to the value of the singular arc $x\_s$, and that the mean value of the state $x\_1$ on each subinterval is equal to the value of the singular arc $x\_s$.

Arguments

  • model : a Model
  • control : a Control extracted from a solution of a Model
  • N : the number of subdivision of the singular arc

Keyword arguments (optional)

  • verbose : if true, print the optimization process (default is false)

Return

  • new_control : a Control composed only by -1 and 1 values
